intro: Pilosella umbellata, commonly known as the common mouse-ear, is a flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. Native to Europe, it is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and blooms from late spring to early summer. It is a perennial herb that spreads through rhizomes and is often used in ecological restoration projects.
